title: Any plan on having a client side replay system anytime soon?
body:
Kind of amazed that an eSports game like League doesn't have it's own replay system yet. Op.GG and LoLreplay are very buggy and don't always work for me. 

Bad players like myself need to watch replays to improve.

replies.body: Riot is apparently working on it. If you try to attach a file to a post you'll see one of them is called .ROFL I hear that is the replay system file.  If a Rioter could tell us more that would be awesome.

.ROFL files were being tested early 2013 for a client-side replay feature. The program is, evidently, still a thing, but there haven't been news in almost two years, last being that the system was heavy to sustain (at least for the PBE server).
I'll see if i can poke some reds once they're awake again for more details, unfortunately most of my contacts are back in Europe.

also, this is me trolling a streamer... if you can ever open it.
How do we open the file? I tried just clicking on it but it crashed LOL.

Yeah, that being the point.
.rofl files are opened by the client. Only, the part of the client that opens them has been removed from the PBE mid-2013. Some might still have the files somewhere, but it'd require some work to get it going.
For now it's just an awesome, yet invisible, act of trolling.
I do hope Riot implements this, or have at least someone from Riot confirm that this is upcoming.
Confirmation from a Riot employee would be great

inb4 you gotta pay rp to access it, riot worse then ea.

nah but srs y hire someone to make replay system when we can just higher more skin designers, PROFIT PROFIT PROFIT. Why would a game that claims to be pioneering esports need a replay system? Riot is a joke of a company.
I'd rather a new client first.
